​Longevity drugs for dogs help humans too - The Times of India
summary:
Longevity drugs for dogs help humans too

Publication Date: Not specified   Source: Times of India

This article discusses the new scientific developments regarding longevity drugs for dogs and their potential implications for human longevity. Dogs may not only be man's best friend but also a key to extending human life.

  • Scientists are studying longevity drugs originally developed for dogs to see if they can also benefit humans.
  • US biotech start-up Loyal is planning to launch a beef-flavored pill (LOY-002) aimed at extending the healthy lifespan of dogs.
  • The Dog Aging Project is testing rapamycin, which has shown potential to improve dogs' health and extend their lifespan.
  • The findings from dog studies may provide insights into human aging processes.
“If this turns out to be successful in dogs, it could be a turning point for research on longevity for humans as well.” - Daniel Promislow, biogerontologist

These findings suggest a hopeful future where pets could play a significant role in helping humans live longer, healthier lives.
newTitle: Longevity Drugs for Dogs: A Potential Path to Human Life Extension

'H-1B Visa System Broken, Needs Major Reform': Elon Musk Days After 'Will Go To War' Vow - News18
summary:
H-1B Visa System Broken, Needs Major Reform: Elon Musk Days After 'Will Go To War' Vow

Date: December 30, 2024 | Source: News

Tesla CEO Elon Musk has labelled the H-1B visa system as “broken” and called for significant reforms just days after expressing a strong defense of the system.

  • Musk states the H-1B visa system needs a “major reform”.
  • He advocates raising the minimum salary requirements for H-1B visas to make hiring overseas more expensive than hiring domestically.
  • The debate reignited following comments from Laura Loomer criticizing the appointment of an Indian-American adviser on AI policy.
  • Former President Trump also expressed his continued support for the H-1B visa program.
Easily fixed by raising the minimum salary significantly and adding a yearly cost for maintaining the H1B, making it materially more expensive to hire from overseas than domestically. I’ve been very clear that the program is broken and needs major reform. — Elon Musk (@elonmusk) December 29, 2024

The discourse around H-1B visas reflects larger immigration debates, particularly within the context of the upcoming Trump administration.
newTitle: Elon Musk Advocates for Major Reform of H-1B Visa System

title: ​6 Very Beautiful Pictures Of Stars Taken By NASA Hubble Space Telescope​ - Times Now
summary:
6 Very Beautiful Pictures Of Stars Taken By NASA Hubble Space Telescope

Publication Date: Dec 31, 2024

Source: Times Now Digital

This article showcases six stunning images of stars captured by the NASA Hubble Space Telescope, highlighting the beauty and complexity of the cosmos.

  • Features images like the Rho Ophiuchi Cloud Complex, capturing the birth of stars.
  • Spotlights Omega Centauri, showcasing evidence of an intermediate mass black hole.
  • Includes images of stars like LAWD 37, which is a spent star.
  • Discusses the Stellar Cradle that shows both young stars and dusty lanes.
  • Highlights ESO 245-5, showcasing a galaxy close to the Milky Way.
  • Reveals the most distant star ever observed by Hubble.
"By making this observation, the NASA/ESA Hubble Space Telescope has achieved a remarkable milestone: spotting the light from a star that formed within the initial billion years after the Universe's inception during the Big Bang."

This collection of images from the Hubble Space Telescope serves as a reminder of the vast beauty of the universe and the ongoing exploration of space.
newTitle: 6 Very Beautiful Pictures Of Stars Taken By NASA Hubble Space Telescope

title: Fabrication of lysozyme bilayers in presence of ions can mimic biological protein absortion on inserted implants - Department Of Science & Technology
summary:
Mimicking Biological Protein Absorption with Lysozyme Bilayers on Implants

Published on: Department Of Science & Technology

A research group has stabilized bilayers of lysozyme protein molecules on silicon surfaces at room temperature, mimicking protein adsorption in living organisms, which can enhance the performance of implants.

  • Lysozyme is a protein found in human biological fluids, known for its four disulfide bonds.
  • The study explores how ions affect the adsorption of lysozyme proteins on implanted biomaterials.
  • Research conducted by Institute of Advanced Study in Science and Technology (IASST), Guwahati.
  • Ion-mediated interactions were observed to stabilize the lysozyme bilayers.
  • Mechanisms include modified hydrogen bonding and hydrophobic/electrostatic interactions.
  • Research published in the New Journal of Chemistry under the Royal Society of Chemistry.
“The entire immobilization process was realized primarily via modified hydrogen bonding, hydrophobic and electrostatic interactions in an ionic atmosphere.” - Dr. Sarathi Kundu

This innovative research has promising implications for improving the integration of implants with biological tissues.
newTitle: Mimicking Biological Protein Absorption with Lysozyme Bilayers on Implants

Boeing shares skid after Jeju Air 737-800 jetliner crash in South Korea | Stock Market News - Mint
summary:
Boeing Shares Drop Following Jeju Air 737-800 Crash in South Korea

Publication Date: December 29, 2023

Source: Live Mint

An unfortunate incident involving a Jeju Air flight has led to a significant decline in Boeing's stock price, along with calls for heightened safety inspections of their aircraft.

  • Boeing Co. shares fell nearly 5.3% at the Wall Street open.
  • The incident occurred on December 29 when a Jeju Air flight encountered landing gear issues, resulting in a crash.
  • The crash claimed the lives of 179 out of 181 people on board, marking it as South Korea's worst aviation disaster in decades.
  • Korean officials ordered a comprehensive inspection of all Boeing 737-800 aircraft after this incident.
  • Market analyses indicate a broader trend of sell-offs in major tech stocks due to rising treasury yields.
"This crash was South Korea's worst airline disaster in decades, triggering an outpouring of grief across the nation and beyond."

The tragic event not only affected the victims and their families but has also led to increased scrutiny over safety protocols for aircraft, particularly in the context of international airline operations.
newTitle: Boeing Shares Drop Following Jeju Air 737-800 Crash in South Korea

SBI Life picks up 10% stake in Bima Sugam India Federation | Company Business News - Mint
summary:
SBI Life Acquires 10% Stake in Bima Sugam India Federation

Date: Not specified | Source: Live Mint

SBI Life has announced its decision to acquire a 10% stake in Bima Sugam India Federation for ₹6.6 crore, aiming to enhance the insurance product marketplace.

  • SBI Life's board approved an investment not exceeding 10% of Bima Sugam's paid-up equity share capital.
  • Bima Sugam India Federation is set to create a centralized marketplace for insurance products and services.
  • The company will invest ₹6.6 crore to purchase 66 lakh equity shares at a face value of ₹10 each.
newTitle: SBI Life Acquires 10% Stake in Bima Sugam India Federation

title: Taylor Swift taking big move as her ‘priorities’ shifted around Travis Kelce; ‘Nashville is the place where…’ - Hindustan Times
summary:
Taylor Swift Moves to Nashville to Strengthen Bond with Travis Kelce

Publication Date: Dec 30, 2024 | Source: Hindustan Times

Taylor Swift is relocating to Nashville, Tennessee, full-time to be closer to her boyfriend, Travis Kelce, reflecting a shift in her personal priorities.

  • The 35-year-old pop star is establishing roots in Nashville to strengthen her relationship with the NFL star.
  • Swift's decision marks a new outlook on life, moving away from her previous base in New York City.
  • Insiders report that her love for Kelce has profoundly shifted her priorities.
  • Nashville holds sentimental value for Swift, as it is where her career began.
  • She has attended numerous Chiefs games since they started dating in September.
“Taylor has grown up a lot in the past couple of years. Falling in love with Travis so deeply has shifted her priorities around a bit and has given her a new outlook on life.”

This move signifies a significant commitment in their relationship as they consider starting a family in the future.
newTitle: Taylor Swift Moves to Nashville to Strengthen Bond with Travis Kelce

'Rupee 58.58 against Dollar in 2014, it's 85.27 now': Congress recalls PM Modi's 2013 remarks on depreciating currency during UPA government

In a recent statement, Congress leaders reflected on Prime Minister Modi's past criticisms regarding the depreciation of the rupee during the United Progressive Alliance (UPA) administration, citing the rupee's significant fall against the dollar from 58.58 in 2014 to 85.27 now.

  • The rupee's current value contrasted sharply with its value during the previous government tenure.

title: Atishi defends Arvind Kejriwal calling her ‘temporary chief minister’, slams Delhi LG VK Saxena - Hindustan Times
summary:
Atishi defends Kejriwal's 'temporary CM' remark, criticizes Delhi LG VK Saxena

Date: Dec 30, 2024 10:33 PM IST
Source: Hindustan Times

Delhi Chief Minister Atishi defended Arvind Kejriwal after he referred to her as ‘temporary chief minister’ in response to criticisms from Lieutenant Governor VK Saxena.

  • Atishi extended New Year wishes to Saxena while addressing his concerns regarding Kejriwal's comment.
  • She emphasized that all elected officials are temporary and serve for the duration of their term.
  • Atishi criticized Saxena for focusing on criticism instead of cooperation.
  • She highlighted the importance of the Mahila Samman Yojana for women in Delhi and accused Saxena of politicizing his position.
  • Atishi stated that Saxena has failed at his responsibilities to keep Delhi safe.
“Governance should remain above petty politics, and I urge you to work alongside us in this spirit,” - Atishi

Atishi concluded by urging Saxena to discard political baggage and work towards citizens' welfare.
newTitle: Atishi defends Kejriwal's 'temporary CM' remark, criticizes Delhi LG VK Saxena

title: Pushpa 2 box office collection day 26: Allu Arjun film remains steady even after three weeks, crosses ₹1160 crore - Hindustan Times
summary:
Pushpa 2 Box Office Collection Day 26: Allu Arjun Film Remains Steady Even After Three Weeks, Crosses ₹1160 Crore

Date: Dec 30, 2024 Source: Hindustan Times

Pushpa 2, starring Allu Arjun, has continued to draw audiences even after three weeks of release, crossing ₹1160 crore at the box office.

  • The film collected approximately ₹6.65 crore on its fourth Monday.
  • Total box office collections stand at ₹1163.65 crore.
  • Week one gross was ₹725.8 crore, followed by ₹264.8 crore in week two and ₹129.5 crore in week three.
  • Despite controversies surrounding a tragic incident at a screening, the film maintained its audience appeal.
“We're extremely sorry for the family, and I will personally be there to support them in whatever way.” - Allu Arjun

The movie continues to have a significant impact at the box office, despite the challenges faced by its lead actor due to recent events.
newTitle: Pushpa 2 Box Office Collection Surpasses ₹1160 Crore

title: This chief minister, with a net worth of ₹15 lakh, is the ‘poorest’ in India, claims report - Hindustan Times
summary:
Mamata Banerjee Declared Poorest Chief Minister in India with ₹15 Lakh Net Worth

Date: Dec 30, 2024 | Source: HT News

The report by the Association for Democratic Reforms highlights that Mamata Banerjee is the chief minister with the lowest assets in India.

  • Mamata Banerjee's total assets are reported at ₹15,38,029, with no immovable assets.
  • Omar Abdullah ranks second, holding assets of ₹55,24,430.
  • Pinarayi Vijayan is third on the list, with total assets of ₹1.18 crore.
  • The report also discusses chief ministers with the most liabilities, including Pema Khandu and Siddaramaiah.
“Mamata Banerjee leads with the lowest assets worth ₹15,38,029.”

This report sheds light on the financial statuses of India's chief ministers and how they vary significantly.
newTitle: Mamata Banerjee Declared Poorest Chief Minister in India with ₹15 Lakh Net Worth

title: Isro launches space docking satellites, India on path to elite club; PSLV last stage has 24 payloads - The Times of India
summary:
Isro launches space docking satellites, India on path to elite club; PSLV last stage has 24 payloads

Publication Date: October 2023 Source: Times of India

India's ISRO has successfully launched a mission involving space docking satellites, positioning the country closer to joining an elite group of nations capable of such advanced space operations.

  • The Indian Space Research Organisation (ISRO) achieved this groundbreaking milestone through the PSLV, which managed to carry 24 payloads.
  • This launch signifies India's growing capabilities in space technology and exploration.
  • The successful docking could pave the way for future missions aimed at space stations and deeper space exploration.
'This launch is a testament to India's progress in the field of space technology.'

This achievement marks a significant step in India's ambitions in space exploration, showcasing advancements in satellite technology and positioning India prominently on the global space map.
newTitle: Isro launches space docking satellites, India on path to elite club; PSLV last stage has 24 payloads

title: "Third Umpire Should Have...": BCCI Top Official Breaks Silence As Yashasvi Jaiswal DRS Row Divides .. - NDTV Sports
summary:
"Third Umpire Should Have...": BCCI Top Official Breaks Silence As Yashasvi Jaiswal DRS Row Divides Cricket World

Publication Date: December 30, 2024   Source: NDTV

BCCI vice president Rajeev Shukla criticizes the third umpire's decision regarding Yashasvi Jaiswal's dismissal during the Boxing Day Test against Australia. The row highlights discrepancies in DRS technology usage.

  • Jaiswal was dismissed on a controversial decision while batting on 84.
  • Shukla stated Jaiswal was clearly not out and that the third umpire should rely on technology.
  • Sunil Gavaskar and other cricket officials criticized the decision.
  • The dismissal led to Australia's victory and a 2-1 series lead.
  • Former umpire Simon Taufel defended the third umpire's decision.
“Yashasvi Jaiswal was clearly not out. Third umpire should have taken note of what technology was suggesting.” — Rajeev Shukla

The incident has sparked significant debate about the reliability of DRS technology and its impact on match outcomes.
newTitle: "Third Umpire Should Have...": BCCI Top Official Breaks Silence As Yashasvi Jaiswal DRS Row Divides Cricket World

title: 10 micro-resolutions you can achieve in 10 minutes or less this New Year 2025 - The Times of India
summary:
10 Micro-Resolutions You Can Achieve in 10 Minutes or Less This New Year 2025

Publication Date: December 31, 2024 • Source: Times of India

As the New Year approaches, focusing on small, manageable changes can lead to more lasting results than traditional, grand resolutions. Here are ten micro-resolutions that can each be accomplished in ten minutes or less.

  • 10 Minutes of Walk

    Start your day with a brisk ten-minute walk to boost heart health and lifespan.

  • 9 Minutes of Reading

    Enhance memory and reduce stress through a quick reading session.

  • 8 Minutes of Preparing a Healthy Snack

    Start your day with a nutritious breakfast incorporating all food groups.

  • 7 Minutes of Stretching

    Relieve stress and prevent injury by taking a few minutes to stretch.

  • 6 Minutes of Journal Writing

    Enhance self-awareness and clarity by writing in a journal.

  • 5 Minutes of Meditation

    Boost focus and productivity through a short meditation session.

  • 4 Minutes of Planning

    Quickly plan your day to improve organization and clarity.

  • 3 Minutes of Decluttering Space

    Prepare for your workday with a tidy workspace.

  • 2 Minutes of Deep Breathing

    Calm your mind and reduce anxiety through deep breathing exercises.

  • Take a Minute to Drink a Glass of Water

    Stay hydrated to improve health and focus.
Each of these 10 goals requires no more than 10 minutes of your time and sets the stage for greater achievements in the New Year.

By adopting these micro-resolutions, you can make meaningful changes that promote wellness and prepare you for larger goals in 2025.
